title: Speaking of Mary
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Funeral rites and ceremonies
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/South Africa - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/South Africa - Race relations
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Mothers and daughters
abstract: What it takes to put a funeral together.
description: Annie Bolitho tells of some of the questions that trouble her in her job as a funeral celebrant. How well does she know the person she's remembering. It makes her wonder how well she knew her mother. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2002062; Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2010); Active; 2010
